docTitle.titlePart:
Search for supersymmetric particles in light gravitino
scenarios

front.div:
Abstract
The search for sleptons and sgoldstinos in the context of scenarios where the lightest
supersymmetric particle is the gravitino, and the search for heavy stable charged
particles in light gravitino scenarios and Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Models,
is presented. Data collected during 2000 with the DELPHI detector at centre-of-
mass energies from around 204 to 208 GeV were analysed and combined with all the
data collected from 1995 to 1999 at lower energies. No evidence for the production
of these particles was found. Therefore, the DELPHI collaboration sets new mass
limits of the supersymmetric and the heavy stable charged particles searched for at
95% confidence level.
front.note: Contributed Paper for EPS HEP 2001 (Budapest) and LP01 (Rome)
